revision.text:
{{wiktionary|Blot|blot}} '''Blot''' may refer to:
== Surname == *[[Guillaume Blot]] (born 1985), French racing cyclist *[[Harold W. Blot]] (born 1938), served as United States Deputy Chief of Staff for Aviation *[[Jean-François Joseph Blot]] (1781–1857), French soldier and politician *[[Yvan Blot]] (1948–2018), French conservative political figure, founder and president of the Club de l'Horloge *[[Jean Blot]] (born 1923), French writer, translator, and senior civil servant of Russian origin *{{ill|Laetitia Blot|fr}} (born 1983), French judoka
== Other == *[[Blot (biology)]], method of transferring proteins, DNA, RNA or a protein onto a carrier *In Germanic paganism and Germanic neopaganism, a [[blót]] is a sacrifice to the gods or other beings **[[Blot (album)|''Blot'' (album)]], a 2003 album by Einherjer, referring to the Germanic practice *''[[The Blot]]'', a 1921 silent film *Another name of a trick-taking card game [[Belot]] *[[Blot (Transformers)]], a character from the Transformers franchise *Ink blots, as used in the [[Rorschach test]] * [[Blot (1994 film)|''Blot'' (1994 film)]], a 1994 film
==See also== *[[Phantom Blot]], a character made by the Walt Disney Company *[[Saint-Rémy-de-Blot]], commune in the Puy-de-Dôme department in Auvergne in central France *''[[The Blot on the Shield]]'', 1915 short film directed by B. Reeves Eason *[[Blott (disambiguation)]] *{{in title}} {{disambiguation}}
